definition: to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
to have no qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken

sentences.english: Suppose I hold up a photograph of a beach with nobody on it.
sentences.chinese: 假设我拿着一张画着无人海滩的图片。

sentences.english: The new Air Force chiefs were talking about how awesome drones were.
sentences.chinese: 空军的新首长正在谈论无人驾驶飞机是多么厉害。

sentences.english: Might UAVs eventually replace manned combat aircraft altogether?
sentences.chinese: 那么无人机是否可能完全替代人工驾驶的战斗机？

sentences.english: In contrast with developed islands, this paper also analyzed the problems exposed in earlier exploitation.
sentences.chinese: 对比已开发无人岛现状，分析开发中凸显的问题。

sentences.english: Moviemakers are using drones to film from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 电影制片人使用无人机在天空里拍电影。

sentences.english: Thanks to unknown military merits young Kim was just promoted to four-star general.
sentences.chinese: 仗着无人知晓的军功，小金刚刚被晋升为四星上将。
奥汉隆说，这些官员怀念他们的无人机。

sentences.english: Because no one knew what you were talking about.
sentences.chinese: 因为无人知晓你在说些什么。

sentences.english: Such personages, I think, would please nobody but the painter that made them.
sentences.chinese: 窃以为此等画像除画家本人外，恐无人喜爱也。

sentences.english: For a home network, it can't be beat.
sentences.chinese: 例如在一个家庭局域网中的使用就无人能敌。

sentences.english: The fascists massacred those women and children in cold blood.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯分子惨无人道地屠杀了那些妇女儿童。

sentences.english: The jailor brought up another livid prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 那个狱卒又带来了一个面无人色的犯人。

sentences.english: Later, in Walpole he was a peerless handball player.
sentences.chinese: 后来在沃波尔，他成了无人可与之匹敌的手球运动员。

sentences.english: The success, is in each individual heart the loftiest dream.
sentences.chinese: 古今中外，无人不在时时刻刻做着成功的梦想。
去歌唱吧，犹如无人在一边谛听。

sentences.english: The situations we face are so complex that no one can guarantee no mistakes at all.
sentences.chinese: 我们面对的情况如此复杂，以致无人能始终都不出错。

definition: someone/people/anyone/there is someone there/occupied (as in restroom)
not to be present/to be out/(euphemism) to pass away/to be deceased
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
haven't/hasn't/doesn't exist/to not have/to not be
